item.title: üåê Introduction of RPC
item.description: RPC(Remote Procedure Call) What is RPC? RPC is a network protocol that can call a remote system process like a local system. Client-Server model Procedure call is also known as function call or subrountine call RPC can be implemented throughout HTTP to TCP layers How does RPC work? A Client starts a client stub process Client stub marshels parameters and sends to local RPC runtime RPC runtime sends to remote RPC runtime Server side will handle the function call and return the message to client RPC runtime Client stub unmarshels the return message and returns to the caller A stub is a piece of code that converts parameters passed between client and server during a remote procedure call.

item.title: üë®üèª‚Äçüíª What I learned from my first job
item.description: Time flies! It’s already been two and a half years since I joined my first company. I remembered the time when a boy was interviewed in Customer Engineer, a new graduate who was participating his first interview of his life. He got lucky and entered the world of Cloud. This post is a summary of the skills and mindset that I learned. First, let me quickly describe what I do in my daily routine.

item.title: üßê Dependency Inversion Principle
item.description: I accidently knew the concept of Dependency Inversion Principle(DIP) when I was developing a project. Its definition: High level modules should not depend on low level modules; both should depend on abstractions. Abstractions should not depend on details. Details should depend on abstractions. Confusing, right? The first time I heard of this principle, I thought it was about the organization of directories. :laughing: Example 1: without DIP Let’s say we have an application that has the following structure:

item.title: üôÖüèª‚Äç How to Avoid Asking Bad Questions
item.description: As a customer engineer, I receive all kinds of questions everyday. For me, I also ask a lot of questions to my colleagues. It is normal if we ask someone for help because we don’t know everything. However, it might be frustrating to handle bad questions. Here are some tips on how we avoid asking bad questions: 1. Google it before asking anyone Sometimes the answer to the question is just one click away.

item.title: About Me
item.description: Lee is an outgoing, meticulous, curious person and a team player. Reach out to lee10202013@gmail.com to connect!
